p: Tucker and Maciarello described five groups based on four principal constituents: (1) camphor > α-thujone > 1,8-cineole > β-thujone; (2) camphor > α-thujone > β-thujone > 1,8-cineole; (3) β-thujone > camphor > 1,8-cineole > α-thujone; (4) 1,8-cineole > camphor > α-thujone > β-thujone; and (5) α-thujone > camphor > β-thujone > 1,8-cineole [ 61]. Unfortunately, while these four principal constituents describe many S. officinalis essential oils, there are other samples that are rich in α-humulene [ 41, 56], viridiflorol [ 26, 34], manool [ 34, 66], or sclareol [ 54].
